required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Modafinil Treatment for Cocaine Dependence and HIV High-Risk Behavior
clinical_study.official_title: Modafinil Treatment for Cocaine Dependence and HIV-High Risk Behavior

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of study is to determine if modafinil promotes cocaine abstinence and reduces high risk behavior in cocaine dependent subjects.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of study is to determine if modafinil promotes cocaine abstinence and reduces HRB in cocaine dependent subjects. Modafinil (300 mg/day) or placebo will be administered in an 8-week double-blind trial to patients meeting diagnostic criteria for cocaine dependence in conjunction with Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants Reporting no Cocaine Craving
primary_outcome.description: Percent of participants reporting no cocaine craving based on Brief Substance Craving Scale (BSCS) - a 4 point likert scale.

primary_outcome.measure: Cocaine Use as Measured by Urine Drug Screen
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome measure was cocaine use measured by self-report, and confirmed by twice weekly urine drug screens. The percentage of participants shows the percentage who were abstinent from cocaine during the last 3 weeks of the trial.

intervention.description: Weekly cognitive behavioral therapy sessions for a period of 8 weeks.

group.title: Modafinil
group.description: modafinil plus CBT Modafinil: 300mg a day for 8 weeks Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT): Weekly cognitive behavioral therapy sessions for a period of 8 weeks.

event.description: Subject was hospitalized for eye surgery
Subject was driving and reportedly lost consciousness, causing his car to hit the side of a house. The expected charges are driving under the influence and malicious mischief with a motor vehicle.
Subject's cocaine dependence let subject to enter an inpatient program.

event.sub_title: Infection in laceration on right hand

event.description: Subject hospitalized for worsening asthma symptoms

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
